title: Creative methods in research with children
abstractText:
The aim of this project is to create opportunities for the exchange of innovative practice in research by developing and running an advanced level Continuous Professional Development (CPD) course at the University of Edinburgh which will explore the use of creative arts based methods in research with children and young people. Creative methods are defined for this project as arts based activities which include drama, music, visual arts, storytelling, film making, dance and online based arts activities.

A key objective is that the course will be developed in partnership with third sector arts based and childrenâ€™s organisations.The course will be targeted at researchers from the third sector and academia as well as the public sector and private sector with the intention of building a community of researchers with an interest in developing skills in using creative methods in research.

The course will be based at the Centre for Research on Families and Relationships (CRFR) at the University of Edinburgh. It will build on a programme of advanced level training in research with children and young people that has been developed at CRFR. Learning from the course will be shared through briefings, academic networks and other non-academic routes.
